name: Information Security Communication Policy
title: Security Awareness and Communication Policy
description: This policy establishes requirements for communicating information security policies, procedures, and awareness information to all personnel and relevant third parties.
scope: This policy applies to all employees, contractors, consultants, vendors, and third parties with access to organizational information systems and data.
purpose: To ensure that information security policies, procedures, and awareness information are effectively communicated to all relevant parties and that security awareness is maintained throughout the organization.
objectives: Establish effective communication channels for security information
Ensure all personnel understand their security responsibilities
Maintain ongoing security awareness throughout the organization
Provide timely communication of security updates and incidents
Support compliance with information security requirements
policy_statements: Information security policies and procedures shall be communicated to all relevant personnel
Security awareness training shall be provided to all employees upon hiring and annually thereafter
Security updates and alerts shall be communicated in a timely manner
Communication methods shall be appropriate for the audience and content
Effectiveness of security communications shall be regularly measured and evaluated
Third parties shall receive relevant security information based on their access level
Security incident communications shall follow established procedures

communication_requirements.New Employees: Security awareness training within 30 days of hire
communication_requirements.All Employees: Annual refresher training and quarterly updates
communication_requirements.Contractors: Security briefing before system access is granted
communication_requirements.Managers: Additional training on security management responsibilities
communication_requirements.IT Staff: Technical security training specific to their roles
communication_requirements.Third Parties: Security requirements communication based on contract terms

roles_responsibilities.Chief Information Security Officer: Overall accountability for security communication program
roles_responsibilities.Information Security Manager: Develop and maintain communication strategies and content
roles_responsibilities.Human Resources: Integrate security communication into onboarding process
roles_responsibilities.Department Managers: Ensure team members receive and understand security communications
roles_responsibilities.Employees: Participate in security training and follow communicated security procedures
roles_responsibilities.IT Administrators: Maintain security communication platforms and systems

compliance_requirements: SOC 2 Type II CC1.2 - Communication and Information
ISO 27001:2013 A.7.2.2 - Information security awareness, education and training
NIST Cybersecurity Framework - Awareness and Training (PR.AT)
PCI DSS Requirement 12.6 - Security awareness program
monitoring_controls: Continuous monitoring of communication channel usage
exceptions: Temporary exceptions may be granted by the CISO for specific business circumstances, with documented justification and compensating controls.
sanctions: Failure to participate in required security communications may result in loss of system access and disciplinary action.
